backend/main.mo: Motoko canister defining core society data models (users, maintenance, expenditures, complaints, notices, visitors) and state, with role-based authorization helpers and CRUD-style APIs for flats, secretary, and guard workflows.
feature_evidence.json: Machine-readable report mapping implemented product features to frontend files, components, and test requirements with confidence levels for feature completion.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summary mapping that briefly describes the purpose of key frontend source files and pages in the application.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS setup defining design tokens, light/dark theme variables, and base styles for the Vision Galaxy Society UI.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point that sets up the root container and loads the React application bundle.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React application entry configuring TanStack Router routes, authentication gating, and role-based dashboard routing for flat owners, secretary, and guard.
frontend/src/components/layout/AppLayout: Shared authenticated layout with header, role-based navigation menu, logout and password change actions, and responsive mobile navigation.
frontend/src/components/layout/Dashboard: Reusable dashboard card component with icon, title, optional description, action button, and visual variants for status emphasis.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Defines a React hook that creates and caches a backend actor using react-query, switching between anonymous and authenticated actors based on Internet Identity and initializing admin access if a secret token is present.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Implements an Internet Identity authentication context and provider, managing login, logout, identity persistence, and login status using Dfinity AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Provides a collection of react-query hooks for fetching and mutating backend data (profiles, maintenance, payments, notices, etc.) through the shared actor abstraction.
frontend/src/index.css: Configures Tailwind CSS base layers and defines extensive CSS variables for light and dark themes, including colors, charts, and layout styling.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React application by rendering App within QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider, and imports global styles.
frontend/src/pages/ChangePasswordPage.ts: Implements a password change page with form validation, backend mutation, success/error feedback, and forced logout after a successful password update.
frontend/src/pages/common/NoticeDetailPa: Displays detailed information for a single notice by ID, fetched from cached notices, with navigation back to the notices list.
frontend/src/pages/common/NoticesPage.ts: Displays a list of society notices sorted by newest first, with empty-state handling and expiry badges. Allows Secretaries to navigate to a notice creation page and all users to view notice details.
frontend/src/pages/flat/ComplaintDetailP: Shows detailed information for a single complaint belonging to the logged-in flat, including status, priority, and resolution notes. Handles missing complaints and provides navigation back to the complaints list.
frontend/src/pages/flat/ComplaintsPage.t: Allows flat users to lodge new complaints via a form and view their existing complaints with status badges. Integrates complaint creation, validation, and feedback via toasts.
frontend/src/pages/flat/ExpendituresPage: Enables users to select a month and year to view society expenditure details, including line items, totals, and notes. Shows an empty state when no expenditure data is available.
frontend/src/pages/flat/FlatDashboardPag: Main dashboard for flat users showing quick-access cards for maintenance, expenditures, complaints, notices, visitors, and profile. Displays an overdue maintenance alert based on the current monthâ€™s payment status.
Provides month/year selection to view maintenance status and record UPI payments for a flat. Supports UPI deep linking, payment submission, and displays paid or pending status with badges.
frontend/src/pages/flat/ProfilePage.tsx: Profile page for flat residents to view and manage up to four mobile numbers associated with their flat, including add/remove/edit and save via API mutations with validation and toast feedback.
frontend/src/pages/flat/VisitorRequestsP: Displays all visitor requests for the logged-in flat, highlights pending requests, and allows accepting or declining requests with status badges and notifications.
frontend/src/pages/guard/GuardDashboardP: Guard dashboard showing summary cards for visitor requests, creating new requests, and viewing notices, including a count of pending approvals and navigation actions.
frontend/src/pages/guard/VisitorRequestC: Form for guards to create a new visitor request by entering visitor details and flat number, then generating and opening a WhatsApp approval message to the flat owner.
frontend/src/pages/guard/VisitorRequestD: Detail view for a single visitor request showing visitor info, purpose, flat number, contact, and current status, with navigation back to the requests list.
frontend/src/pages/guard/VisitorRequests: Lists all visitor requests for guards with sorting, status badges, WhatsApp sender info, and navigation to create new requests or view request details.
frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.tsx: Renders the login page UI and triggers Internet Identity authentication, displaying loading and error states while disabling unused credential inputs.
frontend/src/pages/secretary/ComplaintsA: Provides a complaint management UI for secretaries to filter complaints by status and flat, view details, and update complaint status with optional resolution notes.
frontend/src/pages/secretary/CreateNotic: Implements a form for creating and publishing notices to residents, with optional expiry date handling and navigation back to the notices list on success.
frontend/src/pages/secretary/Expenditure: Allows secretaries to select a month/year and record monthly expenditure items, calculate totals, add notes, and submit the data to the backend.
frontend/src/pages/secretary/OverduePage: Displays overdue maintenance payments by month and year, showing alerts based on the current date and listing flats with pending payments.
frontend/src/pages/secretary/PaymentsPag: Shows maintenance payment status for all flats for a selected period, including paid/pending counts, filters, and a detailed table view.
frontend/src/pages/secretary/SecretaryDa: Renders the main secretary dashboard with summary cards for payments, overdue flats, expenditures, complaints, notices, and settings, each linking to its management page.
frontend/src/pages/secretary/SettingsPag: Secretary-facing React page that lets admins view and update the society UPI ID and WhatsApp number using query/mutation hooks, with form inputs, loading states, and toast notifications.
frontend/src/utils/dates.ts: Date utility helpers for getting current month/year, formatting bigint timestamps into readable dates, and generating month lists and a rolling year range.
frontend/src/utils/overdue.ts: Simple helpers to determine if the current date is past the 6th of the month and whether an overdue notice should be shown based on payment status.
frontend/src/utils/upi.ts: Utility to construct a UPI payment deep link (upi://pay) using a configured UPI ID, amount, currency, and transaction note.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utilities for reading URL parameters from query or hash routes, persisting them in sessionStorage, retrieving/clearing them, and handling sensitive params across navigation.
frontend/src/utils/whatsapp.ts: Helper to build a WhatsApp deep link (wa.me) by cleaning the phone number and URL-encoding the message text.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining dark mode, content paths, custom OKLCH-based color tokens, layout settings, animations, and plugins like typography and container queries.
project_state.json: Project metadata describing the Vision Galaxy Society app, including schema version, overall summary, and a list of implemented features with IDs, requirements, and versions.
